request.description:
### Get Stores

This endpoint is used to retrieve a list of stores.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{site_seller}}/get-stores`
    

#### Response

The response for this request can be documented as a JSON schema. The schema for the response body will include the properties and their data types returned in the response.

This endpoint allows the user to switch to a different store using an HTTP POST request to {{site_seller}}/switch-store. The request should include the store_id in the x-www-form-urlencoded request body.

### Request Body

- store_id (text, required): The ID of the store to which the user wants to switch.
    

### Response

The response of this request is documented as a JSON schema.

## Update User Details

This endpoint allows the user to update their details including name, phone, address, and image.

### Request Body

- `name` (text, required): The user's name.
    
- `phone` (text, required): The user's phone number.
    
- `address` (text, nullable): The user's address.
    
- `image` (file, nullable): The user's profile image.
    

### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

``` json
{
  "status": 0,
  "message": "",
  "data": {
    "token_type": "",
    "user": {
      "id": 0,
      "name": "",
      "email": "",
      "role": [""],
      "registered_store_id": null,
      "phone": "",
      "address": null,
      "image": "",
      "stores": []
    }
  }
}

 ```

- `status` (number): Indicates the status of the update operation.
    
- `message` (string): Additional information or error message.
    
- `data` (object): Contains the updated user details.
    
    - `token_type` (string): Type of token.
        
    - `user` (object): User details including id, name, email, role, registered_store_id, phone, address, image, and stores.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the category information from the specified seller's site.

### Request Body

The request does not require a request body.

### Response

The response will include the category information from the seller's site.

### Response

### Create New Category

This endpoint allows the user to create a new category.

#### Request Body

- Type: x-www-form-urlencoded
    

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON schema. It includes the properties and their types for the response body.

### GET /brand/2

This endpoint retrieves information about a specific brand with the ID of 2.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `id` (number): The unique identifier of the brand.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the brand.
    
- `description` (string): A brief description of the brand.
    
- `logo` (string): The URL of the brand's logo image.
    

Example:

``` json
{
    "id": 2,
    "name": "Brand Name",
    "description": "Brief description of the brand",
    "logo": "https://www.example.com/logo.jpg"
}

 ```

### Add Brand

This endpoint allows the user to add a new brand by making an HTTP POST request to `{{site_seller}}/brand/4`.

#### Request Body Parameters

- `name` (required | string): The name of the brand.
    
- `image` (nullable | image): An image file representing the brand.
    
- `_method` (required): The HTTP method to be used for the request.
    

#### Response

The response will contain the result of the brand addition request.

### Delete Product Review

This endpoint is used to delete a specific product review.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: `{{site}}/product-reviews/8`
    
- Body:
    
    - Type: x-www-form-urlencoded
        
    - Description: No request body parameters
        

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON schema. The specific structure of the response will depend on the implementation of the API and the success or failure of the operation.

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve product information from the specified seller's site.

### Response

The response of this request is a JSON schema representing the product information.

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific product with the ID 37.

The response of this request can be documented as a JSON schema.

This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to delete the product with the ID 31.

### Response

The response of this request is a JSON schema representing the structure of the response data.

### Request Body

- `name`: (string) The name of the product.
    
- `slug`: (string) The URL-friendly version of the product name.
    
- `sku`: (string) The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) of the product.
    
- short_description: (string) The short description of the product.
    
- `description`: (string) The description of the product.
    
- `price`: (number) The price of the product.
    
- `category_id`: (number) The ID of the category to which the product belongs.
    
- `brand_id`: (number) The ID of the brand to which the product belongs.
    
- `has_in_stocks`: (number) Indicates if the product is in stock (1 for true, 0 for false).
    
- `stock`: (number) The available stock quantity.
    
- `status`: (number) The status of the product.
    
- `thumbnail`: (string) The thumbnail image of the product.
    
- `attachments`: (string) Additional attachments related to the product.
    
- `has_variants`: (number) Indicates if the product has variants (1 for true, 0 for false).
    
- `variants`: (array) An array of product variants, each containing label, slug, and options.
    
- `is_trending`: (number) Indicates if the product is trending (1 for true, 0 for false).
    
- `has_discount`: (number) Indicates if the product has a discount (1 for true, 0 for false).
    
- `discount_to`: (string) The date until which the discount is applicable.
    
- `discount_type`: (string) The type of discount (e.g., percentage, fixed amount).
    
- `discount_amount`: (number) The amount or percentage of the discount.
    

### Response Body

The response of this request will be a JSON object containing the details of the newly created product. The response schema includes the following fields:

- `id`: (number) The ID of the newly created product.
    
- `name`: (string) The name of the product.
    
- `slug`: (string) The URL-friendly version of the product name.
    
- `sku`: (string) The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) of the product.
    
- `short_description`: (string) The short description of the product.
    
- `description`: (string) The description of the product.
    
- `price`: (number) The price of the product.
    
- `category`: (object) The category details including ID, store ID, name, slug, type, and parent information.
    
- `brand`: (object) The brand details including ID, store ID, name, slug, image, created date, and updated date.
    
- `has_in_stocks`: (number) Indicates if the product is in stock (1 for true, 0 for false).
    
- `stock`: (number) The available stock quantity.
    
- `status`: (number) The status of the product.
    
- `store`: (object) The store details including ID and name.
    
- `variants`: (array) An array of product variants, each containing ID, product ID, label, slug, and options.
    
- `is_trending`: (number) Indicates if the product is trending (1 for true, 0 for false).
    
- `has_discount`: (number) Indicates if the product has a discount (1 for true, 0 for false).
    
- `discount_to`: (string) The date until which the discount is applicable.
    
- `discount_type`: (string) The type of discount (e.g., percentage, fixed amount).
    
- `discount_amount`: (number) The amount or percentage of the discount.
    
- `created_at`: (string) The date and time when the product was created.
    
- `updated_at`: (string) The date and time when the product was last updated.

                    "price": "60000",

            "label": "Obsidian-marbel",

}

request.description:
The HTTP PUT request updates the product information for the specified product ID. The request payload includes the product name, slug, SKU, description, price, category ID, brand ID, stock availability, status, thumbnail, attachments, variants, trending status, discount details, and other relevant product information.

The response of this request can be documented as a JSON schema representing the structure and data types of the updated product information.

### GET /blog

This endpoint retrieves a list of blogs.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: {{site_seller}}/blog
    
- Body: x-www-form-urlencoded
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

``` json
{
    "status": 0,
    "data": {
        "blogs": [
            {
                "id": 0,
                "user_id": 0,
                "category": {
                    "id": 0,
                    "store_id": 0,
                    "name": "",
                    "slug": "",
                    "type": "",
                    "has_parent": null,
                    "created_at": "",
                    "updated_at": ""
                },
                "title": "",
                "slug": "",
                "image": "",
                "content": "",
                "status": "",
                "created_at": "",
                "updated_at": ""
            }
        ]
    }
}

 ```

#### Request Body

No request body parameters were provided for this request.

#### Response Body

The response contains a JSON object with a "status" field and a "data" field. The "data" field contains an array of "blogs", where each blog has an "id", "user_id", "category", "title", "slug", "image", "content", "status", "created_at", and "updated_at" fields.

This API endpoint is used to make an HTTP POST request to create a new store on the seller's site. The request should include form-data in the request body with the following parameters:

- `currency` (text): A nullable string parameter representing the currency of the store.
    
- `logo` (file): A nullable image file representing the logo of the store.
    
- `type` (text): A nullable string parameter representing the type of the store.
    
- `description` (text): A nullable text parameter representing the description of the store.
    

Upon a successful request, the API will return a response with the details of the newly created store.

This endpoint allows you to update the details of a specific store by sending an HTTP PUT request to the specified URL. The request should include a payload in the raw request body type, containing the updated information for the store.

### Request Body

- `name`: The name of the store.
    
- `slug`: The unique identifier for the store.
    
- `email`: The email address associated with the store.
    
- `phone`: The contact phone number for the store.
    
- `location`: The physical location of the store.
    
- `status`: The status of the store.
    
- `description`: A brief description of the store.
    
- `currency`: The currency used by the store.
    
- `settings`: An array containing the store settings, including contact and social media details.
    

### Response

The response will contain the updated details of the store, confirming the changes made.

### GET /store/8

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific store.

#### Request

No request body is required for this request.

- `site_seller` (path parameter) - The unique identifier of the store.
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `id` (number) - The unique identifier of the store.
    
- `name` (string) - The name of the store.
    
- `location` (string) - The location of the store.
    
- `owner` (object) - The details of the store owner, including `name` and `email`.
    
- `products` (array) - An array of products available in the store, each containing `id`, `name`, and `price`.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "id": 8,
  "name": "Sample Store",
  "location": "Sample Location",
  "owner": {
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "johndoe@example.com"
  },
  "products": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Product 1",
      "price": 100
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Product 2",
      "price": 150
    }
  ]
}

 ```

request.description:
### Profile Password Change

This endpoint is used to change the password for the user's profile.

#### Request Body

- form-data
    
    - `old_password` (text, required): The old password of the user.
        
    - `password` (text, required): The new password for the user's profile.
        
    - `confirm_password` (text, required): The confirmation of the new password.
        

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON schema. The structure of the response will follow the JSON schema format, detailing the properties and their types expected in the response.

formdata.value: Please get the order in time

query.description: nullable | string | ex: name / phone / email / address / payment_method
